thread.title: KCRA Today: Top stories to start your day for Dec. 29
thread.title_full: KCRA Today: Top stories to start your day for Dec. 29

title: KCRA Today: Top stories to start your day for Dec. 29
text: KCRA Today: Accused Davis serial killer deemed mentally competent, calls for Loloee to resign, weather Impact Day Saturday KCRA 3 is rounding up all the information you need to know to get a head start on your day. Here you'll find what you missed overnight, what's happening throughout the day, the forecast and how your commute is shaping up. You can also watch our [morning newscasts live from 4-10 a.m. here.](https://www.kcra.com/nowcast) WHAT'S HAPPENING IN NORCAL Accused Davis serial killer to return to court, state hospital declares him mentally competent | Carlos Dominguez, the man accused of multiple fatal stabbings in Davis this year, has been determined mentally competent enough to stand trial. The Yolo County District Attorney's Office told KCRA 3 the court received a report from the state hospital that Dominguez has been restored to competency. In July, Dominguez stood an initial 5-day trial to determine his mental capacity to be held accountable for two deadly stabbings and another attempted murder. [Read more here.](https://www.kcra.com/article/accused-davis-serial-killer-carlos-dominguez-mentally-competent/46246582) Sacramento mayor, members of city council call on Loloee to resign. Some constituents agree | Outside Sean Loloee's Viva Supermarket on Norwood Avenue Thursday, some District 2 constituents called for the Sacramento City Council member to resign from his seat. "Enough is enough," said Margo Santana, a longtime community member in the district. "We need to really get him to resign peacefully and just let the next council people come up in here and try and mend and heal this community." [Read more here.](https://www.kcra.com/article/sacramento-mayor-asks-loloee-resign-constituents-agree/46247669) Judge: California lawmaker Vince Fong can run for both State Assembly and Congress | A Sacramento Superior Court Judge on Thursday said Republican Assemblyman Vince Fong can run for both State Assembly and former House Speaker Kevin McCarthy's Congressional seat. In her order, Judge Shelleyanne W.L. Chang wrote in part, "The Court notes that it is concerned about the outcome of this Petition, as it may result in voter confusion and the disenfranchisement of voters if Fong is ultimately elected for both offices but does not retain one. [Read more here.](https://www.kcra.com/article/california-lawmaker-vince-fong-state-assembly-and-congress/46246124) Modesto authorities, auto businesses hope new law will decrease catalytic converter thefts | A new California law means catalytic converter thieves could face harsher penalties starting in 2024. Assembly Bill 641 was introduced by California state Rep. Vince Fong to help law enforcement agencies combat rising incidents of catalytic converter thefts seen happening across the state. While small, catalytic converters are expensive and crucial to operating automobiles. [Read more here.](https://www.kcra.com/article/modesto-authorities-auto-businesses-hope-new-law-will-decrease-catalytic-converter-thefts/46246930) California Secretary of State will not remove Trump from 2024 primary election ballots | Former President Donald Trump will be on the ballot for California's March primary. A certified list of candidates who will appear on the primary ballot was released by Secretary of State Shirley Weber on Thursday. Trump is one of nine Republicans listed. [Read more here.](https://www.kcra.com/article/california-secretary-of-state-will-not-remove-trump-from-2024-primary-election-ballots/46247661) WHAT'S HAPPENING ELSEWHERE Maine bars Trump from ballot as US Supreme Court weighs state authority to block former president | Maine's Democratic secretary of state on Thursday removed former President Donald Trump from the state's presidential primary ballot under the Constitution's insurrection clause, becoming the first election official to take action unilaterally as the U.S. Supreme Court is poised to decide whether Trump remains eligible to return to the White House. [Read more here.](https://www.kcra.com/article/maine-bars-trump-from-ballot/46246394) SpaceX Falcon Heavy launches X-37B plane, one of the US military's most fascinating secrets | SpaceX's hulking Falcon Heavy rocket returned to the skies Thursday evening, and this time it launched a mysterious spacecraft for the U.S. military that will carry out cutting-edge research. The rocket lifted off from NASA's Kennedy Space Center in Florida at 8:07 p.m. ET, carrying the military's X-37B space plane — which is uncrewed and operates autonomously — to unprecedented altitudes. The launch streamed live on SpaceX's website. The side boosters returned to Earth and safely touched down. [Read more here.](https://www.kcra.com/article/spacex-falcon-heavy-rocket-launch-secretive-military-space-plane/46242718) World population up 75 million this year, standing at 8 billion on Jan. 1 | The world population grew by 75 million people over the past year and on New Year's Day it will stand at more than 8 billion people, according to figures released by the U.S. Census Bureau on Thursday. [Read more here.](https://www.kcra.com/article/world-population-up-75-million-this-year/46250187) Russia unleashes what may be one of the biggest aerial barrages against Ukraine, Zelenskyy says | Russia launched 122 missiles and 36 drones against Ukrainian targets, officials said Friday, killing at least 13 civilians in what an air force official said was the biggest aerial barrage of the 22-month war. The Ukrainian air force intercepted 87 of the missiles and 27 of the Shahed-type drones overnight, Ukraine's military chief Valerii Zaluzhnyi said. [Read more here.](https://www.kcra.com/article/russia-unleashes-biggest-aerial-barrages-against-ukraine/46248843) Nikki Haley doesn't mention slavery when asked what caused the Civil War. She later walks that back | Republican presidential candidate Nikki Haley was asked at a New Hampshire town hall about the reason for the Civil War, and she didn't mention slavery in her response. She walked back her comments hours later. Asked during Wednesday night's town hall in Berlin what she believed had caused the war — the first shots of which were fired in her home state of South Carolina — Haley talked about the role of government, replying that it involved "the freedoms of what people could and couldn't do. [Read more here.](https://www.kcra.com/article/nikki-haley-slavery-question-civil-war-walks-back/46244244) WHAT'S COMING UP TODAY? - 8:45 a.m. | Are New Year’s resolutions doomed to fail? Brent Franson, CEO of habit-tracking app “Most Days,” sits down with KCRA to speak about how to achieve our goals for 2024. - 9:30 a.m. | Martha Santana-Chin, Medicare Medi-Cal President, is speaking with KCRA 3 about Health Net’s new campaign to assist newly eligible Californians with Medi-Cal enrollment. TODAY'S WEATHER OUTLOOK Meteorologist Eileen Javora says some in Northern California are waking up to patchy fog for the morning. We can expect a mix of clouds and a bit of sun through most of Friday, with temperatures in the 60s. Javora says it’ll be breezy by the afternoon, with some rain starting by the late afternoon into the evening. Rain will fall overnight into early Saturday, but will taper to just a few showers during the day. Rain totals in the Valley and Foothills may be around an inch, and snow will pick up overnight into early Saturday with snow levels around 6,000 feet and 3 to 6 inches of accumulation. Chain controls are likely overnight into early Saturday. | KCRA 3 FIRE THREAT INDEX | [Track fire conditions across Northern California regions](https://www.kcra.com/article/kcra-3-fire-index-track-fire-conditions-across-northern-california-regions/39984520) REAL-TIME TRAFFIC MAP ( [App users, click here to see our interactive traffic map](https://www.kcra.com/traffic).)
